Yes, here is some advice for people with oily skin during the winter:

1. Use a lightweight moisturizer: Even if you have oily skin, it's still important to moisturize during the winter. Look for a lightweight, oil-free moisturizer to avoid overloading your skin with excess oil. 2. Choose a gentle cleanser: Oily skin can be prone to breakouts, so it's important to choose a gentle cleanser that won't strip your skin of its natural oils. Look for a non-comedogenic cleanser that's specifically formulated for oily skin. 3. Exfoliate regularly: Regular exfoliation can help to remove excess oil and dead skin cells, which can clog pores and lead to breakouts. However, be careful not to over-exfoliate, as this can cause irritation and make oily skin worse. 4. Avoid hot showers: Hot water can strip your skin of its natural oils, making it even more oily. Take lukewarm showers instead to avoid further drying out your skin. 5. Use blotting papers: If your skin becomes oily during the day, use blotting papers to absorb excess oil without removing your makeup or moisturizer. Remember, oily skin still needs moisture even during the winter, so it's important to find a balance between keeping your skin hydrated and avoiding excess oil buildup.
